column4: Does anyone know why the xorg.conf file in ubuntu 8.10 is almost empty?
the new xorg is automagic - meaning it configures itself automatically without relying on a configuration file (xorg.conf)

so say I installed the application Touchpad which requires shmconfig to be "true" in xorg.conf but xorg.conf does not contain the synaptic input section anymore. Would the only way to enable shmconfig be making a shmconfig file in /etc/hal/fdi/policy/ dir?
no, as Zzeiss says - you can put directives in xorg.conf to override automagic settings with your own
so it's a matter of creating the appropriate input device section
I supposed a quick google search would  provide instructions how to appropriately add input device sections?
sure, but the authoritative source might be the xorg.conf manpage  i.e.   man xorg.conf
thanks I'll check out the manual
is there a timeout period when using su-to-root?
